Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add priority levels (low, medium, high) to action items

Features added:
- Database migration to add priority field with enum type
- Updated ActionItem model with priority field and scopes
- Enhanced GroqService to extract priority from AI analysis
- Updated WebhookController to store priority with each action item
- Enhanced SyncController to include priority in sync responses
- Added priority filtering to sync endpoint (?priority=high)
- Added priority statistics to sync stats endpoint

AI now analyzes urgency based on:
- HIGH: Urgent, time-sensitive, critical, important deadlines
- MEDIUM: Normal priority, routine tasks (default)
- LOW: Optional, nice-to-have, can be deferred

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add sender field to track who messages came from

Features added:
- Database migration to add sender field to action_items table
- Updated ActionItem model to include sender in fillable fields
- Enhanced GroqService AI prompt to extract sender information from messages
- AI extracts sender from email headers, message content, or signatures
- Updated WebhookController to store sender with each action item
- Updated SyncController to include sender in sync responses

The AI now identifies who sent the message by looking for:
- Email "From:" headers or sender information
- Names or email addresses in the message body
- Person who made the request
- Returns null if sender cannot be determined

Example sync response now includes:
{
  "action": "Complete the report by Friday",
  "priority": "high",
  "sender": "Sarah Johnson",
  ...
}
